thread.title: Nearly 5 million BlendJets recalled due to fires, blades breaking off
thread.title_full: Nearly 5 million BlendJets recalled due to fires, blades breaking off

author: Alex Arger
title: Nearly 5 million BlendJets recalled due to fires, blades breaking off
text: Cinnamon in recalled applesauce pouches had extremely high lead levels The FDA did not find elevated lead levels in any of the 136 samples of Austrofoods' other products tested that did not contain cinnamon. [LEARN MORE](https://scrippsnews.com/stories/cinnamon-in-recalled-applesauce-pouches-had-extremely-high-lead-levels/) Nearly 5 million BlendJet devices in the U.S. and Canada will need to be replaced due to fire or injury risk. Portable blender maker Blendjet is recalling nearly 5 million of its devices after receiving dozens of injury reports and causing hundreds of thousands of dollars in consumer property damage. The [Consumer Product Safety Commission](https://www.cpsc.gov/Recalls/2024/BlendJet-Recalls-4-8-Million-BlendJet-2-Portable-Blenders-Due-to-Fire-and-Laceration-Hazards) issued a warning Thursday saying the company's BlendJet 2 Portable Blenders could overheat or catch fire and that their blades can break off while in use, affecting about 4.8 million products in the U.S. and 117,000 in Canada. â€” US Consumer Product Safety Commission (@USCPSC) [#Recall]: 4.8 Million [@BlendJet]2 Portable Blenders. The blenders can overheat or catch fire & the blender blades can break off. Get Free Replacement. Contact: [https://t.co/xqAPoZ0us1]or 844-334-0562. Full recall notice: [https://t.co/vXrV3uD3Ce] [pic.twitter.com/leQrtnmBn3] [December 28, 2023] So far, there have been 329 reports of blades coming off during use and 17 additional reports of overheating or fires that resulted in about $150,000 in property damage claims. These incidents also caused 49 reported minor burn injuries and one reported laceration injury. "Out of an abundance of caution, our company updated the base of the BlendJet 2 to feature thicker blades and an improved electrical configuration," BlendJet said Thursday. "These updates were incorporated many months ago into all BlendJet 2 devices manufactured by the company." The affected products were sold from October 2020 through November 2023 at Costco, Walmart, Target and other stores nationwide and online. U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission Although BlendJet says the BlendJet 2s that are currently for sale are safe to use, the CPSC says consumers should verify if theirs is included and immediately stop use if so. To check your device's safety, identify the serial number printed on the bottom of the base. Those with the first four digits between 5201 and 5542 are subject to the recall. You can also go to BlendJet's [product recall tool](https://blendjet.com/safetyandrecall) to complete the identification process. If your device is affected, contact BlendJet for a free replacement of the blender's base unit. You will need to remove and cut the base's rubber seal and email or upload a photo to the company's website to receive the replacement part. The FDA did not find elevated lead levels in any of the 136 samples of Austrofoods' other products tested that did not contain cinnamon. Certain batches of Enfamil brand allergy formulas may have come into contact with a dangerous bacteria that can cause sepsis. A fuel pump defect involving 2.6 million Honda and Acura vehicles could increase risk of engine stalling or failure. The names were included in a 2015 lawsuit against Epstein's former girlfriend by a woman who says she was one of Epstein's sex-trafficking victims. The United States' largest aircraft carrier is returning from the Mediterranean Sea, where it has been stationed for nearly three months. One lucky winner in Michigan is having an especially great start to 2024 after matching all six Powerball numbers to win the jackpot.
